alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 10 at 9:45PM EST until March 14 at 8:05PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River near Rivervale. White River at Hazleton and Petersburg. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River near Bedford. .Minor flooding is ongoing across western and southern Indiana. Flooding is expected to end early this weekend on the East Fork White, but persist on the lower White into early next week and lower Wabash through the middle of next week. Additional precipitation over the weekend is not expected to be enough to impact river levels. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Petersburg. * WHEN...Until late Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 21.3 feet, State Road 257 south of Washington began to flood during May 2008 after local rains of more than an inch on very wet soils with Petersburg at 21.3 feet and rising and Shoals at 15.5 feet and rising. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EST Friday /7:30 PM CST Friday/ the stage was 21.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM EST Friday /7:30 PM CST Friday/ was 21.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.9 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
